definitions.definition: following a style that is popular at a particular time
definitions.sensetop: it is fashionable to do somethingfashionable among somebody

examples.text: He was laughed at by his more fashionable friends.
It's becoming fashionable to have long hair again.
examples.contextForm: it is fashionable to do something

examples.text: Such thinking is **currently fashionable** among right-wing politicians.
These cars are no longer fashionable among the young.
a young and suddenly fashionable actor
‘Exchange’ is currently a fashionable word in archaeology.
Recently it has become fashionable to dismiss this theory.
The illustration shows examples of fashionable dress in the late 1840s.

definitions.definition: used or visited by people following a current fashion, especially by rich people

examples.text: She lives in a very fashionable part of London.
The shop moved to a more fashionable address.
The play is a satire on fashionable society in Victorian times.
